p:
Before the introduction of the first emerging strain, the intra-annual dynamics of the population CS is described by a standard diffusion model with logistic growth:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$\partial_{t} c^{n} = D{\Delta }c^{n} + rc^{n} \left( {z\left( {\varvec{x}} \right) - c^{n} } \right)$$\end{document}
∂ t
c n
= D Δ

+ r
c n

c n
. Here,
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\Delta }$$\end{document}
Δ
is the Laplace 2D diffusion operator (sum of the second derivatives with respect to coordinate). This operator describes uncorrelated random walk movements of the viruses, with the coefficient
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$D$$\end{document}
D
measuring the mobility of the viruses (e.g.,
26, 37 ). The term
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$r z\left( {\varvec{x}} \right)$$\end{document}
r z
x
is the intrinsic growth rate (i.e., growth rate in the absence of competition) of the population, which depends on the density of host plants
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$z\left( {\varvec{x}} \right)$$\end{document}
z
x
and on a coefficient
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$r$$\end{document}
r
(intrinsic growth rate at maximum host density). Under these assumptions, the carrying capacity at a position
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\varvec{x}}$$\end{document}
x
is equal to
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$z\left( {\varvec{x}} \right)$$\end{document}
z
x
, which means that the population densities are expressed in units of the maximum host population density. The model is initialized by setting
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$c^{1980} \left( {0,{\varvec{x}}} \right) = (1 - m_{c} ) z\left( {\varvec{x}} \right)$$\end{document}
c 1980
0 ,
x
=
( 1 -
m c
)
z
x
, where
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$m_{c}$$\end{document}
m c
is the winter decay rate of the CS (see the description of the inter-annual stage below). In other terms, we assume that the CS density is at the carrying capacity in 1979, i.e., 5 years after its first detection and 20 years before the first detections of ESs
38 .
